competitor_analysis.strengths: Well-maintained website with clear service listings, bilingual support, emergency services advertised prominently. Good detail on local compliance requirements.
competitor_analysis.weaknesses: Limited educational content about grease management, some areas lack contact forms, dated navigation structure in some sections.
content_gaps: Business owner resource hub for FOG management

competitor_analysis.strengths: Strong social presence and client reviews, family-owned messaging, detailed explanations of certifications, bilingual support.
competitor_analysis.weaknesses: Generic SEO copy dominates, lack of local area-specific content, minimal technical resources.

competitor_analysis.strengths: Modern design, professional presentation, service area clearly defined..
competitor_analysis.weaknesses: Missing regulatory guidance entirely, unclear about response times, minimal onsite documentation.

grease trap cleaning.seasonality: Moderate seasonality, peak period late winter/early spring.

recommendations.rationale: Healthy recurring demand, low-to-medium competition, high CPCs driven by commercial clients. Clear gaps in regulatory support content present large opportunity for thought leadership via Google.
content_plan_90_days: Month 1: Lead gen tools prioritized—create 'DERM Compliance Calendar for Restaurants in Miami-Dade' checklist and 'Miami Grease Trap Cost Estimator.'
Month 2: Build authority section; document recent citations/permits publically with anonymized cases and resolution tips.
Month 3: Layer in long-tail guides: 'The Miami Restaurant Owner’s Grease Compliance Playbook' and landing pages for 'Emergency Backup + Response.'
